description: FDO Profile for digital media object

fdoProfile.description: PID to a machine readable description of the attributes in the FDO record

fdoRecordLicense.description: The licence for the FDO record, required to be always public domain

digitalObjectType.description: PID to a description of the Type of digital object that defines the metadata, bit sequences (if any) and operations for the object

digitalObjectName.description: Name of the object type for humans

pid.description: The PID of which the FDO record is part, in DiSSCo this is a Handle or DOI. It is recommended to store this pid also in the local collection management system for the specimen.

pidIssuer.description: In case of a DOI this is a PID for the DOI Registration Agency

pidIssuerName.description: Human-readable name of the PID issuer

issuedForAgent.description: In the case of a digital specimen, this is a PID for DiSSCo as the agent responsible for serving the digital specimen object

pidRecordIssueDate.description: Date the PID record was created

pidRecordIssueNumber.description: Starts with 1 and is incrementally increased by 1 every time the pid record is updated. Compatible with DOI schema requirements.

structuralType.description: Nature of the digital object, compatible with DOI schema requirements. The nature of a digital specimen object is always "digital". Other digital objects (outside DiSSCo) could be of physical, performance or abstraction nature.

pidStatus.description: A PID is considered to have a lifecycle, PID status indicates the status in the life cycle, e.g. draft, active, retired. PID statuses are described further in the PID infrastructure design.

10320/loc.description: XML document describing location(s) of the resource

referentType.description: A generic name for the type of object that the DOI refers to. This is different from digitalObjectType that points to a specific type, e.g. there can be different types of digital specimens that each have a slightly different metadata schema because they describe a different kind of specimen, like a botanical versus a geological specimen.

referentDoiName.description: The bare DOI Name string for the PID, e.g. without the resolver.

referentName.description: In the case of a digital specimen this is the name for the object in the collection, which can be anything from a taxon name to a collection number.

primaryReferentType.description: The primary type of the referent in the DOI Kernel XML Schema (e.g. creation, party, event). This is an open list. For digital specimens and media it will always be creation.

mediaHost.description: ROR or, in absence of a ROR, Wikidata Qnumber for the administrative organisation responsible for hosting the digital media object. Note that this can be DiSSCo also (use DiSSCo QID in that case). Notehe organisation may use an external repository like morphobank to host the object.

mediaHostName.description: Name for the administrative organisation hosting the digital media (name derived from ROR or Wikidata  at the point of creating the FDO record).

isDerivedFromSpecimen.description: Whether or not the media is a record/depiction of a specimen

linkedDigitalObjectPid.description: Handle or DOI, the DO to which the media should be linked.

linkedDigitalObjectType.description: The DO type to which the media is linked, one of: digital specimen, agent, facility, supplementary material

linkedAttribute.description: A specific attribute within the linked DO to which the media should be linked, such as an identification or event or logo

primaryMediaId.description: Primary ID supplied by the original provider for the media (compatible with ac:providerManagedID). the mediaUrl may be the ID itself, for example: https://data.nhm.ac.uk/media/93012a86-a00f-435a-a985-8e3c0ab6e51b

primaryMediaObjectIdType.description: Nature of institutional identifier. A globally unique identifier (e.g. a UUID) must be marked as "Global", while a resolvable identifier (e.g. a URL or a DOI including the proxy) must be marked at "Resolvable". If the identifier is unique only within the institution or collection system, it must be marked as "Local"

dcterms:type.description: (Previously primaryMediaObjectType) Dublin Core: Type, describing the (primary) nature of the image. For example an image of a label will have primaryDcType text, an image of a specimen will have primaryDcType physical object. One of: text, image, sound, dataset, software, interactive, event, physical object + Audiovisual Core: 3D object type

dcterms:format.description: https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml. Only mimetypes for audio, image, model, video, Text, application are allowed, excluded are mimetypes for font, example, message, multipart.

derivedFromEntity.description:
Other digital entity where the media was derived from, specified by its ID or PID.
 e.g. a label image extracted from an herbarium sheet image, a video with the first minute frameset of another video, a thumbnail from a larger file.

licenseName.description: creative commons or other licence for the media object (file) that permits some usage rights. DiSSCo cannot accept images with full copyright, e.g. for which there is no licence that gives DiSSCo some usage rights.

licenseUrl.description: Machine-actionable licensing information. Uses SPDX Identifiers

rightsholderName.description: usually the creator of the object, holds the copyright for the object. Defaults to the supplier of the media object. if no other rightsholder is specified.

dcterms:conformsTo.description: To indicate the media object conforms to a certain standard, e.g. IIIF
